availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Grant Green (Frankfort, Kentucky, attorney, Kentucky Secretary of State, and Kentucky Auditor of Public Accounts)

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, attorney, politician, and auditor. Henderson County, Kentucky, native. Son of John Green and Martha Dixon Green. Married to Catharine Smith Overton Green in Frankfort, Kentucky, on February 28, 1855. Father of Henry D. Green, Eliza O. Green, and Grant Green Jr. Clerk in Henderson County in 1850. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1851 to 1852. Owned eight enslaved persons in 1860. Auditor of Public Accounts of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1860 to 1865. Secretary of State of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1863 to 1865. Vestryman at the Ascension Church in Frankfort from 1863 to 1898.

ab.bibl:

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 96B.
